threat_severity.level_description: Severity MEDIUM because it was considered trojan.

attributes.magic: ELF 32-bit MSB executable, MIPS, MIPS-I version 1 (SYSV), statically linked, stripped

crowdsourced_ai_results.analysis: This ELF binary is a malicious IoT botnet agent, specifically a variant of the Mirai or Satori family. It is designed to exploit network vulnerabilities, maintain persistence, and conduct DDoS attacks. Key malicious behaviors include: 1) Exploitation: Function sub_40498c implements an exploit against Huawei Home Gateways using the UPnP SOAP interface (/ctrlt/DeviceUpgrade_1) and hardcoded credentials ('dslf-config'), attempting to execute shell commands to download and run further payloads from /tmp/.d. 2) Process Killing: It features a 'killer' routine (sub_409088, sub_40629c) that scans /proc and /proc/net/tcp to identify and terminate competing malware processes and common shells. 3) DDoS Flooding: The binary contains several specialized functions (sub_401990, sub_402870, sub_403730) dedicated to generating high volumes of network traffic (UDP, TCP, and ICMP floods) with randomized header fields. 4) Botnet C2: It daemonizes via fork/setsid and establishes a persistent connection to a command-and-control server to receive attack instructions.
